ARABIC: أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Give full measure. Do not skimp.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Give full measure and do not cheat;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Fill up the measure and do not diminish the goods of people,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Maintain just measure in your business and do not cause loss to others.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Measure in full, and do not be of those who reduce.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Give full measure, and cause no loss (to others)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Give a full measure and be not of those who diminish;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Fill up the measure, and be not cheaters,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Give full measure, and be not of those who give less (than the due).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Give full measure, and cause no loss to others.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Give full measure, and be not of those who cause others to lose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Observe the full measure, and do not be of those who give short measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Give just measure, and cause no loss (to others by fraud).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Give full measure, and cause no loss (to others).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Fill up the measure, do not be among the cheats,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Give full measure, and do not cheat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:181] Give full measure and do not be of those who give short measure,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Give full measure) when you measure or weigh, (and be not of those who give less (than the due)) in measurement and weighing; this is because they were well known for giving less than what is due in measurement.
